text: Katumbo (Dance) is an album by American trumpeter Johnny Coles recorded in 1971 for the Mainstream label.Johnny Coles discography accessed November 13, 2014Edwards, D., Callahan, Eyries, P., Watts, R. & Neely, T. Discography of the Mainstream Label (Preview), accessed November, 13, 2014 ==Reception== AllMusic awarded the album 3 stars.Allmusic listing accessed November 13, 2014 ==Track listing== # "Never Can Say Goodbye" (Clifton Davis) - 3:01 # "The September of My Years" (Jimmy Van Heusen, Sammy Cahn) - 5:29 # "728" (Johnny Coles) - 7:17 # "Petits Machins" (Miles Davis, Gil Evans) - 3:41 # "Betty's Bossa" (Cecil Bridgewater) - 4:28 # "Funk Dumplin'" (Coles) - 6:49 == Personnel == *Johnny Coles - trumpet, flugelhorn *Astley Fennell - trombone *Howard Johnson - tuba *Gregory Herbert - tenor saxophone *Cedar Walton - piano, electric piano *Reggie Workman - electric bass *Bruce Ditmas - drums == References == Category:1971 albums Category:Johnny Coles albums Category:Mainstream Records albums Category:Albums produced by Bob Shad
title: Katumbo (Dance)
